target_text: Yes, if a vehicle is impounded by law enforcement due to parking violations, an additional lien for the unpaid parking bail may be added. This allows the authority to recover the fines associated with the tickets through the lien.

input_text: Is there any fee for retaining Yosemite license plates?
target_text: Yes, there is an annual retention fee that you must pay in order to keep your Yosemite license plates when registration is not renewed.

input_text: What notices does a lienholder need to send before a sale?
target_text: The lienholder must send a Notice of Pending Lien Sale at least 20 days prior to the sale to the registered and legal owners, interested parties, and the DMV Lien Sale Unit. Additionally, they must advertise the sale in a newspaper of general circulation in the county where the sale will occur, or post notice in public places if no such newspaper exists.

input_text: What is the difference between a registered owner and a legal owner?
target_text: The registered owner is the individual or entity listed on the DMV’s official records for the vessel, while the legal owner is the person or party holding the legal title. In many cases, the registered owner and legal owner are the same, but they can differ if, for example, there is a lien against the vessel.

input_text: Can I notify the DMV about the sale of my vessel online?
target_text: Yes, you can notify the DMV about the sale of your vessel online by submitting the Notice of Release of Liability (REG 138) form. You can choose to do it by mail or through the DMV's online services.

input_text: Can I keep my Yosemite license plates if I don't renew my registration?
target_text: Yes, you have the option to retain your Yosemite license plates even if the registration is not renewed, as long as you pay the annual retention fee.

input_text: Do I need a salvage certificate to register a salvaged vessel?
target_text: No, a Salvage Certificate is neither issued nor required for a salvaged vessel when registering it. Instead, you should follow standard transfer application procedures as outlined by DMV.

input_text: What should I do if I receive mismatched license plates?
target_text: If you receive mismatched license plates, you need to submit a completed Application for Replacement Plates, Stickers, Documents (REG 156) form along with the mismatched plates. This will initiate the process for obtaining new plates. Make sure to write both license plate numbers and indicate 'mismatched plates' on the REG 156 form.

input_text: What is an Application for Unobtainable Title Certification, and when can it be used?
target_text: An Application for Unobtainable Title Certification can replace the usual evidence of ownership documents when specific conditions are met: the applicant is an insurance company, at least 30 days have passed since the settlement acceptance date, and two written attempts have been made to obtain the ownership documents.

input_text: What are the registration requirements for electric commercial vehicles?
target_text: For electric commercial vehicles and electric passenger vehicles that are transporting passengers for hire, the applicant must provide a weight certificate if the unladen weight is 4,000 pounds or more. If the vehicle's unladen weight is clearly under 4,000 pounds, an estimated weight from the owner is acceptable.

input_text: What are the requirements for my vehicle to qualify for the DV license plates?
target_text: Your vehicle must be owned by you, a qualified disabled veteran, and must not be used for transportation for hire, compensation, or profit. The vehicle also needs to display DV License Plates. Additionally, you may need to provide proof of eligibility to law enforcement upon request.

input_text: When does a lien on a vehicle become effective?
target_text: A lien becomes effective either when the registered owner is presented with a written statement of charges for the completed work or services, or 15 days after the completion of those services—whichever happens first. If the vehicle was towed, the lien arises upon transport.

input_text: What should I do if my vehicle title application has issues with notarization?
target_text: If your application has issues with notarization, it will be returned for corrections. You need to ensure that the legal owner's releasing signature is notarized correctly according to California notary requirements before resubmitting.

input_text: What steps do I need to take to replace my stolen DP placard ID card?
target_text: To replace a stolen DP placard ID card, you need to submit the Application for Replacement Plates, Stickers, Documents (REG156) indicating that your original ID card was stolen. Make sure to follow any local reporting procedures for stolen property, if applicable.

input_text: What are the notification requirements for repairs exceeding a certain cost?
target_text: If the cost for repairs or services exceeds $1,500, or if storage charges exceed $1,025 ($1,250 for vehicles worth over $4,000), the legal owner of the vehicle must be notified before any work is done. This ensures that the owner is aware of potential financial liabilities.

input_text: Is the Mussel Fee sticker included in my vessel registration renewal?
target_text: No, the Mussel Fee sticker is not included in the vessel registration renewal process. Vessel owners must now purchase the sticker separately through the online Quagga Sticker Request application as the renewal notice no longer displays the Mussel Fee.

input_text: When is a forklift truck exempt from registration?
target_text: A forklift truck is exempt from registration if it is designed primarily for loading, unloading, and stacking materials and is operated on the highway only to transport products across a highway in a loading, unloading, or stacking process, provided it does not operate along the highway for a distance greater than one-quarter mile.

input_text: How is the transfer of ownership handled for Pearl Harbor Survivor License Plates?
target_text: The license plate remains with the owner during the transfer of ownership of the vehicle, and the transfer is processed as usual according to the DMV procedures.

input_text: Who is eligible to apply for Firefighter License Plates?
target_text: Eligibility for Firefighter License Plates is limited to regularly employed or retired firefighters, volunteer firefighters, or members of a deceased firefighter's family. Specifically, surviving family members include the spouse (including domestic partners but excluding former spouses) and any children of the deceased firefighter.

input_text: What should I do if I have a title that describes the wrong vehicle?
target_text: If you have a California Certificate of Title that describes the wrong vehicle, you need to give the title to the rightful owner of the vehicle that is correctly described on the title. After that, you should ensure that you obtain the correct, properly endorsed California Certificate of Title for the vehicle you currently possess.

input_text: Is there a record of excess proceeds from lien sales?
target_text: Yes, the Lien Sale Unit at DMV headquarters maintains a file that tracks all excess proceeds deposited with the federal government over the past four years.

input_text: Does the document I receive from a dealer need to include anything specific for registration?
target_text: Yes, the document from the dealer, whether it is a certificate of origin, bill of lading, or invoice, should accurately describe the vessel and include information that identifies the transaction to ensure a smooth registration process.

input_text: Do I need to change the expiration date if I transfer my vehicle's license plates?
target_text: Yes, the expiration date must be changed to 12/31 for the new vehicle when you transfer Legislative license plates that have this fixed yearly expiration date.

input_text: Are there any specific requirements for the bond when registering my vehicle?
target_text: Yes, when a bond is required for vehicle registration, it must include a REG 256 form completed by the applicant that states the reason for submitting the bond. Additionally, the bond must have original signatures and not a preprinted signature with notary acknowledgment. The bond protects both the DMV and the applicant against losses due to ownership defects.

input_text: Is there a discount on the lien sale preparation fee if the vehicle is redeemed?
target_text: Yes, if the vehicle is redeemed before the lien sale notifications have been mailed, only half of the lien sale preparation fee can be charged. Additionally, this fee cannot be charged if the vehicle is redeemed within 72 hours of its initial storage.

input_text: What specific fees do I need to pay for salvaged vessel transfer?
target_text: For the transfer of a salvaged vessel, you will need to pay two transfer fees as well as any other required fees. However, a replacement title fee does not apply in this case.

input_text: What happens to the expiration date when I reassign 12/31 fixed expiration date license plates?
target_text: When you reassign Legislative (fee-paid and annual exempt) license plates with a fixed 12/31 expiration date, the registration expiration date for the vehicle to which these plates are assigned must be updated to also reflect a 12/31 expiration date.

input_text: What is the timeframe for paying the registration fees for a salvaged vehicle in California?
target_text: Fees for registering a salvaged vehicle must be paid within 20 days of the first known operation after the sale date shown on the salvage certificate to avoid penalties. It is crucial to keep track of this timeline to ensure that you are compliant and do not incur additional charges.

input_text: What are special CF numbers, and who can obtain them?
target_text: Special CF numbers are reserved for issuance to specific categories such as livery for hire (rental) boats, fee-exempt vessels, city or county-owned livery boats, dealers, manufacturers, and those with special use cases. These numbers are issued only by the Vessel Section of the Registration Processing Unit at DMV headquarters.

input_text: Can a lien release on REG 166 be used to replace a lost title for a newer vehicle?
target_text: No, for vehicles that are two model years old or newer, a lien release on REG 166 is not acceptable for replacing a lost title. The legal owner/lien holder must directly apply for the replacement title.

input_text: What documents must a lienholder send to interested parties when disposing of a low-value vehicle?
target_text: When disposing of a low-value vehicle, the lienholder must complete and send a Notice of Intent to Dispose of a Vehicle Valued at $500 or Less (REG 684) to all interested parties. This includes the registered owner, legal owner, and any other individuals with an interest in the vehicle. The notice must be sent by certified mail or with a U.S. Postal Service Certificate of Mailing.

input_text: What documentation is needed for an original sequential Whale Tail License Plate application?
target_text: To apply for an original sequential Whale Tail License Plate, you must submit a completed REG 17 form, the registration card of the vehicle in your name or documentation necessary for its registration, the current license plates assigned to that vehicle, and pay the applicable fees.

input_text: Is a medical certification necessary to apply for Disabled Person License Plates?
target_text: No, a medical certification is not required for applicants who have already been issued California Disabled Veteran License Plates or a permanent Disabled Person placard. In such cases, you would simply write the DV License Plate number or DP placard number on the application.

input_text: What should I be aware of when transferring personalized special license plates?
target_text: When transferring personalized special license plates, you should be aware that specific guidelines must be followed. Both owners need to complete the REG 17 forms, and associated license plate fees are due for the transfer. This is particularly important for personalized plates, as the process may involve additional steps to ensure that the custom features of the plates are retained for the new owner.

input_text: Who is eligible to obtain Legislative License Plates in California?
target_text: In California, current or retired federal or state legislators are eligible to obtain Legislative License Plates for their personal vehicles. This allows them to display their respective district number on the plates.

input_text: What percentage of time must a vessel be used for commercial deep sea fishing to qualify for tax exemption?
target_text: To qualify for the use tax exemption, a vessel must be utilized at least 50 percent of the time in a commercial deep sea fishing operation outside the territorial waters of California.

input_text: Can a vehicle registered to a trust have Disabled Person License Plates?
target_text: Yes, Disabled Person License Plates can be issued for vehicles registered to a trust as long as the applicant's full name appears as part of the trust name or as a trustee. This includes examples like 'Mary Smith Trust' or 'Mary Smith Trustee'.

input_text: What happens if I disagree with the decision made at the post-storage hearing?
target_text: If you disagree with the decision made during the post-storage hearing, you can seek a review of that decision in accordance with Government Code §11523.

input_text: What documentation do I need to provide to claim the tax exemption for my fishing vessel?
target_text: To claim the tax exemption for your fishing vessel, you must submit the owner’s Statement of Facts on the back of the Application for Registration Number, Certificate of Ownership, and Certificate of Number for Undocumented Vessel (form BOAT 101). This statement should detail the vessel's operation related to commercial deep sea fishing.

input_text: How long is the Historical Vessel Plaque valid for?
target_text: The Historical Vessel Plaque is valid for the life of the vessel for which it is issued.

input_text: Do I need to pay a fee to exchange my Livery License Plates?
target_text: Yes, there might be fees involved depending on the type of replacement plates you are requesting, especially if you need new regular series plates.

input_text: What steps do I need to take if I realize that my vehicle's value is over-reported?
target_text: If your vehicle's value is over-reported, you need to submit a Statement of Facts (REG 256) form that includes the correct vehicle value, the date of vehicle purchase, and a declaration that you believe the incorrect value was recorded during registration. Additionally, you must provide the California Certificate of Title or an Application for Replacement or Transfer of Title (REG 227) unless there is a lienholder on the vehicle record. Finally, you need to pay any fees owed based on the corrected vehicle value and submit an Application for Refund (ADM 399) for any overpaid fees.

input_text: What types of vehicles can receive Lake Tahoe Conservancy License Plates?
target_text: Lake Tahoe Conservancy License Plates can be issued for automobiles, commercial vehicles, trailers, and motorcycles. For motorcycles, the plates can be personalized with two to five characters.

input_text: What happens if a dealer sells a new vehicle without a franchise?
target_text: If a dealer sells a new vehicle without holding the appropriate franchise, they are violating California Vehicle Code §11713.1(f)(1). This can result in legal consequences, including fines or revocation of the dealer's license.

input_text: How long does an interested party have to oppose a lien sale?
target_text: Owners and interested parties have 15 days from the date the Notice of Pending Lien Sale is mailed to file a Declaration of Opposition in order to contest the lien sale.

input_text: Are dismantlers required to pay any fees when they acquire vehicles from public agencies?
target_text: No, dismantlers who acquire vehicles from public agencies are exempt from paying any fees or penalties that may have accrued for those vehicles. This exemption applies as long as they maintain a copy of the resolution or order authorizing the vehicle's disposition in their business records.

input_text: Who regulates yacht and ship brokers in California?
target_text: In California, yacht and ship brokers, as well as 'for hire' operators, are regulated and licensed by the California State Parks Division of Boating and Waterways.

input_text: What should dismantlers submit when acquiring low-value vehicles?
target_text: Dismantlers must submit the Notice To Dismantler, also known as the Report of Vehicle to be Dismantled (REG 42), to document the acquisition of the low-value vehicle.

input_text: Is there a specific form for the license plate application?
target_text: Yes, you need to complete the Special Recognition License Plate Application (REG 17A) form to apply for Press Photographer License Plates. This form must be signed by the applicant's employer.

input_text: What happens if I fail to notify the DMV about my address change?
target_text: Failing to notify the DMV of your address change within the required 15 days may lead to potential legal issues, including fines or penalties. It is advisable to make this notification promptly to ensure your vehicle records are accurate.

input_text: Who is responsible for estimating the value of a vehicle in a lien sale?
target_text: For lien sale purposes, the public agency is responsible for determining the estimated value of the vehicle.

input_text: Is it necessary to submit a bill of sale when applying for a nonrepairable vehicle certificate?
target_text: Yes, bills of sale may be necessary to complete the chain of ownership during the application for a nonrepairable vehicle certificate.

input_text: What is the consequence if the lienholder does not comply with the lien sale requirements?
target_text: If the lienholder does not comply with the requirements for conducting a lien sale, they may have to seek recourse through civil action, as they will not be authorized to sell the vessel.

input_text: What form do I need to submit to the DMV when I sell my vessel?
target_text: You need to submit the Notice of Release of Liability (REG 138) form to the DMV to notify them of the sale. This form must be completed and sent within five calendar days of the sale.

input_text: What happens if I don’t destroy my mutilated DP placard ID card?
target_text: If you do not destroy your mutilated DP placard ID card, it may lead to potential misuse or confusion regarding your eligibility. It's important to ensure that you follow the procedure of destroying the mutilated card before applying for a replacement.

input_text: What is the diligent effort process in relation to vehicle ownership applications?
target_text: The diligent effort process is a protocol that allows applicants to satisfy the requirements for supporting documents when they cannot obtain the necessary documents to demonstrate vehicle ownership. This includes complying with regulations such as the seller’s odometer disclosure, ensuring all aspects of the application are addressed even when typical documentation is missing.

input_text: Is there any specific form for applying for CMOH License Plates?
target_text: Yes, you'll need to complete and submit the Special Recognition License Plate Application (REG 17A) as part of your application for CMOH License Plates.

input_text: What types of Yosemite license plates can I get?
target_text: You can choose between two types of Yosemite license plates: a sequential series or a personalized plate. The personalized plates can have two to seven characters for automobiles, commercial vehicles, and trailers, while motorcycles are limited to two to five characters.

input_text: Where should the transom sticker be placed on a motorized vessel?
target_text: The transom sticker should be affixed facing outward on the exterior of the stern or transom of the motorized vessel. This placement ensures visibility and compliance with safety regulations.

input_text: What does the sticker color indicate for Permanent Fleet Registration (PFR) vehicles?
target_text: For Permanent Fleet Registration (PFR) vehicles, the CVRA weight decals and year stickers are issued in gold color with 'PFR' printed in black. This distinct color coding identifies the vehicle as part of a fleet under a permanent registration status.

input_text: Can out-of-state dealers get titles for vehicles from auctions?
target_text: Yes, out-of-state dealers can request a transfer of title to their dealership name when they purchase a used vehicle from an auto auction, provided that their home state does not accept a REG 227.

input_text: How much will the replacement registration card fee cost?
target_text: The specific amount for the replacement registration card fee is typically set by the DMV, and it can vary. You should check with your local DMV for the exact fee.

input_text: How is the axle count determined for half-track vehicles?
target_text: For half-track vehicles, the axle count is determined by a specific formula: they are considered to have one-half as many axles as the total number of wheels that support the vehicle's weight and load. This means if a vehicle has, for instance, six wheels in total, it would be classified as having three axles.

input_text: What is the time frame within which I must apply for a lien sale to extend the storage lien for a vehicle valued at $4,000 or less?
target_text: For vehicles valued at $4,000 or less, an application for lien sale must be submitted within 15 days from the date the lien arises to extend the storage lien to a total of up to 120 days.

input_text: What qualifies as cemetery equipment exempt from registration?
target_text: Cemetery equipment refers to vehicles, implements, or equipment that are specifically designed or altered for maintaining or operating cemetery grounds. Such equipment is only considered exempt if it is incidentally operated or moved on a highway, and it must display a special ID plate if it is moved over a highway.

input_text: What if my motorized vessel is inflatable? Can I still use the transom sticker?
target_text: If your motorized vessel is inflatable and the transom sticker cannot adhere to the surface of the stern, you should follow the guidelines provided by the authorities. In such cases, alternative placements or methods for ensuring awareness of carbon monoxide hazards may need to be considered.

input_text: What information must be included in the MCO/MSO?
target_text: The MCO/MSO must include the manufacturer's name and address, make, identification number, body type, year model, vehicle series or model name, transfer date, recipient's name, and the signature of the manufacturer's agent. This information verifies the vehicle's details and ownership history.

input_text: What is the authentication process for YOM plates?
target_text: The authentication process for YOM plates involves taking the plates to a DMV field office. DMV personnel will check their condition and verify that the plates correspond to the correct year model vehicle.

input_text: Are Disabled Person License Plates available for commercial vehicles?
target_text: Yes, Disabled Person License Plates can be issued for commercial vehicles. However, only one commercial vehicle with an unladen weight of 8,000 pounds or less is exempt from the weight fee. Additional commercial vehicles assigned DP License Plates are subject to all registration fees.

input_text: Can I correct the VIN if I don’t have the California Certificate of Title?
target_text: No, you cannot correct the VIN without having the California Certificate of Title. It is one of the required documents for initiating a correction for the VIN or engine number on your vehicle.

input_text: What do I need to do if I want to process a correction when the lienholder has the title?
target_text: To process a correction when the lienholder holds the title, you need to provide the necessary documents such as a Verification of Vehicle (REG 31) form or a Statement of Facts (REG 256) form. Additionally, you'll be required to collect any fees due and send the California Certificate of Title and other items to the lienholder to complete your application.

input_text: What are the conditions under which a forklift truck is exempt from registration?
target_text: The conditions for a forklift truck to be exempt from registration include that it must be designed primarily for loading, unloading, and stacking materials, used on a highway solely to transport products or materials for those purposes, and not operated along the highway for more than one-quarter mile.

input_text: How do I get a refund if my personalized license plate request is rejected?
target_text: To obtain a refund for a rejected personalized license plate request, your original REG 17 form will be returned along with the application fee if you applied as an individual. If only part of the fees are being refunded, ensure the fee is converted to a receipt, especially if paid by means other than a personal check.

input_text: What should I do if I want to renew my Arts Council License Plates?
target_text: When renewing your Arts Council License Plates, you will need to pay an additional fee associated with the renewal process.

input_text: What happens if I have unpaid taxes on my boat?
target_text: If you have unpaid taxes on your boat, the DMV will not renew your registration or transfer the title to or interest in the vessel. This means you will be unable to legally operate the vessel until the tax issue is resolved.

input_text: Do International Traffic Vehicles have to leave California after their business?
target_text: Yes, International Traffic Vehicles must leave California as soon as they finish their business operations. They are not intended to remain in the state, and their presence is only for the duration needed to conduct business activities.

input_text: What constitutes a nonrevivable junk vehicle?
target_text: A nonrevivable junk vehicle is defined as one valued at $500 or less that has been abandoned, and whose removal and disposal was authorized by a licensed dismantler or scrap iron processor, often initiated by a law enforcement officer or a designated public agency employee.

input_text: How long can a vessel stay in California without being registered?
target_text: A vessel with an assigned federal number can stay in California for up to 90 consecutive days without needing to be registered.

input_text: What information do I need to provide when updating my address?
target_text: When updating your address, you need to provide the following information: your name and new address as the lienholder, the vehicles to be updated (listed by make, license plate number, and vehicle identification number or VIN), and the names of the registered owners of those vehicles.

input_text: Is there a procedure for returning incorrect license plates?
target_text: Yes, there is a procedure for returning incorrectly issued license plates. You should contact the DMV office that issued the incorrect plates to seek instruction on returning them and ensuring they reach the correct office.

input_text: Does the MCO/MSO need to be notarized?
target_text: Reassignments on the MCO/MSO do not need to be notarized in California, even if the document includes a space for notarization. However, it is essential that all other specified requirements are met for the MCO/MSO to be accepted.

input_text: Is there a fee for renewing or reassessing Pearl Harbor Survivor License Plates?
target_text: No additional fee is required for renewing or reassessing Pearl Harbor Survivor License Plates. They can be renewed or reassigned without any extra charges.

input_text: What type of bond do I need for registering a vessel?
target_text: For registering a vessel, you need either a vessel bond specifically or a motor vehicle bond with an attached rider that covers the vessel. This ensures that the bond protects against any defects in ownership during the registration process.

input_text: What forms do I need to complete for registering a kit vehicle?
target_text: To register a kit vehicle, you need to complete the Application for Title or Registration (REG 343), include the labor cost, and provide vehicle verification using REG 31/REG 343 or REG 124. Additional documentation may include the Manufacturer’s Certificate of Origin, major components receipts, and any necessary inspections.

input_text: How do half-track vehicles differ from regular vehicles?
target_text: Half-track vehicles differ from regular vehicles primarily in their rear design, which uses caterpillar tracks instead of traditional wheels. This allows them to navigate rough or uneven terrain more effectively than standard wheeled vehicles, making them suitable for military applications and off-road use.

input_text: What happens to the lien sale preparation fee once charged?
target_text: The lien sale preparation fee becomes part of the possessory lien, meaning that it can be included in the total amount owed on the lien.

input_text: Are there any vehicles that do not qualify as firefighting vehicles?
target_text: Yes, privately-owned vehicles like hazardous materials response vehicles, command post communication vehicles, and various passenger and transport vehicles do not qualify as firefighting vehicles as they are not designed primarily for that purpose.

input_text: What parking privileges do Disabled Person License Plates provide?
target_text: Vehicles that display Disabled Person License Plates and/or a Disabled Person placard are entitled to certain parking privileges not available to other vehicles, as outlined in California Vehicle Code §22511.5. These privileges include access to designated disabled parking spaces.

input_text: Are there fees involved in getting Breast Cancer Awareness License Plates?
target_text: Yes, there are fees required when applying for both original sequential and personalized Breast Cancer Awareness License Plates. You need to provide payment when submitting your application.

input_text: Is there any special process I need to follow when transferring my Lake Tahoe Conservancy License Plates to a new owner?
target_text: The transfer process for Lake Tahoe Conservancy License Plates is typically the same as other license plates. The plates remain with you, and the transfer to the new vehicle owner is handled according to standard transfer procedures, so you don’t need a specific process exclusive to these plates.

input_text: Are there any exceptions where notarization is not required for the title transfer?
target_text: Yes, there are two exceptions. Notarization is not required when a sole registered owner (RO) signs the legal ownership section to transfer ownership to a financial institution, or when an insurance company, or their agent, is transferring a total loss salvage vehicle back to the insurance company with an acceptable lien satisfaction document.

input_text: What are the steps to take when resolving duplicate renewal notices?
target_text: First, determine which is the correct renewal notice. Then, close the incorrect vehicle record by entering the appropriate planned nonoperation (PNO) code or clearing the transaction if all documents and fees are submitted. If the vehicle record cannot be corrected at your local office, you may need to send your application to the DMV headquarters.

input_text: What does the new owner need to do to retain the special license plates?
target_text: The new owner must complete and submit a REG 17 form along with the vehicle transfer application. This form indicates their intention to apply for the special license plates they wish to retain. Without this form, the transfer of the license plates cannot be processed.

input_text: What types of vehicles can receive Veterans Organization License Plates?
target_text: Veterans Organization License Plates can be issued for automobiles, commercial vehicles, trailers, and motorcycles. For motorcycles, the personalized plates can have two to five characters, while other vehicles may have plates personalized with two to six characters.

input_text: What are Year of Manufacture (YOM) license plates?
target_text: YOM License Plates are official California license plates that were manufactured for specific vehicle models: those issued in 1969 or prior for autos, trailers, and motorcycles, and those issued in 1972 or prior for commercial vehicles. These plates can be assigned to currently registered vehicles of corresponding model years.

input_text: What documents do I need for the Vehicle Application?
target_text: For the Vehicle Application, you need to submit the usual on or off-highway vehicle registration documents, which may include a smog certification when appropriate, along with the required fees.

input_text: Are Yosemite license plates transferable if I sell my car?
target_text: Yes, Yosemite license plates belong to the owner and can be transferred to another vehicle. This means if you sell your car, you can retain the Yosemite plates and transfer them to a new vehicle.

input_text: Are there any restrictions on what characters I can use for my personalized license plate?
target_text: Yes, there are specific restrictions on characters for personalized license plates in California. For instance, the number zero cannot be used; only the letter 'O' is acceptable. The number one must be shown as '1,' and the letter 'I' must be shown as 'I' with no substitutions allowed. Additionally, special characters like asterisks and slashes are used to represent spaces in the configuration.

input_text: When can I apply for a title replacement without being present in person?
target_text: You are not required to appear in person to apply for a title replacement if your name, address, and driver's license or ID number on the application match those on DMV records. Additionally, if the application is submitted through a dealer, registration service, or other authorized agents, your physical presence may not be necessary.

input_text: What happens after the 10-day redemption period?
target_text: After the 10-day redemption period, if the vehicle is not redeemed, the former owner forfeits their rights to reclaim it, and the subsequent 10 days will be counted as part of the overall 20-day fee payment timeline.

input_text: What happens if an undocumented vessel does not display a CF number?
target_text: If an undocumented vessel does not display a valid CF number while operating in California waters, it may be subject to penalties and enforcement actions. It's important for vessel owners to ensure their vessels are properly registered to avoid legal issues.

input_text: What are the benefits of documenting my pleasure vessel?
target_text: Documenting your pleasure vessel provides several benefits, including proof of ownership, easier financing, and eligibility to operate in certain areas that may require documented status. It also helps with tax assessments and provides a greater level of protection in maritime matters.

input_text: What is the maximum speed limit for golf carts?
target_text: Golf carts are not allowed to exceed a speed of 15 miles per hour. Moreover, they cannot be operated on highways with a posted speed limit over 25 mph, unless allowed by a local authority ordinance.

input_text: How does a lien affect vehicle ownership?
target_text: A lien affects vehicle ownership by placing a legal claim on the vehicle, meaning that the owner cannot sell or transfer the vehicle without first resolving the debt associated with the lien. The lienholder can take possession of the vehicle if the debt remains unpaid.

input_text: Are there any fees associated with special license plates?
target_text: Yes, there are fees associated with special license plates. These fees can vary depending on the type of special plate requested. For detailed fee information, you should refer to Appendix 1F, which outlines the specific costs involved in obtaining different special license plates.

input_text: Are there any fees associated with transferring personalized special license plates?
target_text: Yes, there are fees due for transferring personalized special license plates. When completing the transfer, both the current owner and the new owner should be aware that license plate fees will apply as part of the transaction.

input_text: What do I need to do to retain my personalized license plates?
target_text: To retain your personalized license plates, you must complete a Special Interest License Plate Application (REG 17) form, which shows the configuration of your personalized license plates. You must also pay the retention fee each year, regardless of whether the plates are assigned to a vehicle.

input_text: How does the SPCNS Certificate of Sequence affect the smog check for my vehicle?
target_text: The SPCNS Certificate of Sequence affects your vehicle’s smog check by giving you the option to follow different emission standards. You can either comply with the smog requirements based on the year of the engine, which may be more lenient if the engine is older, or the requirements of the current registration year, which could be more stringent.

input_text: Who needs to provide the REG 8?
target_text: The REG 8 must be provided by the licensed remanufacturer to the dealer when the vehicle is sold, and then the dealer must endorse it to the retail purchaser during the sale process.

input_text: Do I need to register my vessel to obtain a Historical Vessel Plaque?
target_text: No, a vessel is not required to be registered or documented in order to obtain a Historical Vessel Plaque.

input_text: Who do I contact to verify the information if my personalized plate is incorrect?
target_text: To verify information regarding an incorrect personalized license plate, you can contact the Field Office Service Unit (FOSU) at (916) 657-6978, where they can assist in confirming details from your original application.

input_text: What are the requirements for SE dealers and manufacturers to operate equipment?
target_text: SE dealers and manufacturers can operate or move special construction equipment and other specified vehicles on public highways, but they must display an identification plate on the equipment. This identification helps distinguish their operations during delivery or demonstration of sales.

input_text: When did federal regulations require vessel manufacturers to assign a HIN?
target_text: Federal regulations mandating that vessel manufacturers assign a Hull Identification Number (HIN) to each vessel they build came into effect on November 1, 1972.

input_text: If I receive a vehicle through a lien sale, how can I ensure the title transfer?
target_text: To ensure a proper title transfer after receiving a vehicle through a lien sale, you need to collect and submit the required documents: the Application for Title or Registration (REG 343), the endorsed California Certificate of Title or a valid bill of sale, proof that the previous owners were notified of the sale, and any additional documentation like the Verification of Vehicle and odometer disclosure. You must also check if a smog certification is required based on the vehicle type.

input_text: Can I resolve a lien sale dispute through the DMV?
target_text: No, lien sale disputes must be resolved in court. The DMV does not involve itself in these civil matters.

input_text: What should I do if I can't obtain the necessary documents to prove vehicle ownership?
target_text: If you are unable to obtain the required documents to establish your ownership of a vehicle, you must submit a Statement of Facts (REG 256) form. This form is essential for substantiating your claim of ownership when standard evidence is unavailable.

input_text: What is a CF number and when is it assigned?
target_text: A CF number is a permanent registration number assigned to undocumented vessels in California upon their registration. This number consists of the letters 'CF,' followed by four digits and a two-letter suffix, which is used to track the registered vessel within the national vessel registration system.

input_text: What happens if the vessel sold has no HIN?
target_text: If the vessel has no Hull Identification Number (HIN), the lienholder has to assign one according to specific instructions from the DMV outlined in Chapter 24. This must be done before clearing the application for the vessel.

input_text: What forms are required for requesting regular series license plates if I want to release my OGLP?
target_text: To request regular series license plates after releasing your OGLP, you need to submit a REG 156 alongside a REG 17 marked 'RELEASE INTEREST'.

input_text: What are the requirements for registering a go-cart as an OHV?
target_text: To register a go-cart as an off-highway vehicle, it must meet certain emission standards and other requirements specified by the California Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) for OHVs. You'll need to check these specific criteria to ensure compliance before you move forward with registration.

input_text: What happens if I don't pay the retention fee for my personalized license plates?
target_text: If you do not pay the annual retention fee for your personalized license plates, you may lose your right to retain them, and they could potentially be reassigned to another owner.

input_text: What should the BOAT 152 include?
target_text: The BOAT 152 form must include essential details about the vessel, such as its make, hull identification number (HIN), and state of registration. If the vessel does not have a California CF number or a HIN, you'll need to submit a Vessel Verification form (BOAT 111) completed by a licensed verifier or law enforcement officer.

input_text: How does a public agency find out who has an interest in a removed vehicle?
target_text: The public agency or the lienholder, at the public agency's request, must access DMV records to obtain the names of all individuals or entities that have an interest in the vehicle. This ensures that all interested parties are notified appropriately.

input_text: Can I obtain the ABCs of California Boating booklet online?
target_text: Yes, the ABCs of California Boating booklet can be obtained online. It is available on the California State Parks Division of Boating and Waterways website at dbw.parks.ca.gov.

input_text: How does the 10-day redemption period affect fee payments?
target_text: The 10-day redemption period is included as part of the 20-day calculation for payment of fees. To clarify, you would start counting 20 days from the sale date, and the first 10 of those days are the redemption period.

input_text: What documentation do I receive after buying a vehicle from a lien sale?
target_text: After purchasing a vehicle from a lien sale, you should receive the completed REG 168 form, certified mailing receipts, and any necessary DMV authorization documents. These documents confirm the sale and may be required for future registration.

input_text: Can I get a Historical Vessel Plaque for any boat?
target_text: No, the Historical Vessel Plaque is only available for power-driven pleasure crafts constructed of wood prior to December 31, 1942.

input_text: What are common uses for an affidavit?
target_text: Affidavits are commonly used in legal contexts, such as in court cases to provide testimony, to verify identity or facts during transactions, and in various applications that require proof of certain assertions.

input_text: What is a Statement of Facts REG 256?
target_text: A Statement of Facts REG 256 is a form that you must submit which details the specific condition of the vessel you are trying to revive. This statement helps the authorities understand the status of the vessel and any relevant details that might affect its revival.

input_text: What is the process for a family member to keep a CMOH License Plate?
target_text: To keep a CMOH License Plate as an heirloom, a family member must submit a REG 256 form indicating their relationship to the CMOH Plate holder and affirming that they will not use the plate for registration purposes.

input_text: What does a legal owner need to do to redeem their vessel after a lien sale?
target_text: To redeem a vessel after a lien sale, the legal owner must pay the total amount of the lien, along with all costs, expenses related to the lien, and any interest accrued at the legal rate from the date of the lien until repayment.

input_text: Can military surplus vehicles be registered for on-highway use?
target_text: Military vehicles, commonly referred to as Humvees, cannot be registered for on-highway use. However, they can be registered for off-highway use when proper documentation is provided, specifically the United States Government Certification to Obtain Title to a Vehicle (SF 97-1) form.

input_text: What proof do I need to show for eligibility?
target_text: Applicants need to provide proof of eligibility by presenting their fire department identification, an International Association of Firefighters (IAFF) membership card, or a California Professional Firefighters (CPF) Callback Association membership card. This documentation must be verified as part of the application process.

input_text: Can you give examples of corrections that might not involve fees?
target_text: Examples of fee-free corrections might include fixing a typo in your name, correcting the address on your DMV record, or updating information that does not have a direct fee associated with it.

input_text: Can nonresident military personnel register vessels in California?
target_text: No, nonresident military personnel cannot register vessels as nonresident military in California. The state has specific restrictions regarding vessel registrations for nonresident military members.

input_text: What happens if I submit a personalized license plate application with an offensive word?
target_text: If you submit a personalized license plate application containing an offensive word, the DMV will reject the application and provide you with a reason, typically citing that the configuration violates its criteria for good taste and decency.

input_text: What are adjustments in the context of DMV records?
target_text: Adjustments are specific types of corrections applied to transactions in DMV records that necessitate payment of a fee. This could include modifying transactional details that have financial implications.

input_text: What documents do I need to register a revived junk vehicle?
target_text: To register a revived junk vehicle, you need to submit the following documents: a completed Application for Title or Registration (REG 343) form, a junk receipt or bill of sale from the dismantler, bills of sale to establish ownership chain, a Declaration of Gross Vehicle Weight form if necessary, a REG 31 form for inspection, and any required brake and light adjustment certificates. Additionally, a smog certification may be required if applicable.

input_text: What types of fees should I expect when registering a surplus vehicle?
target_text: When registering a surplus vehicle, you may encounter several fees, which could include registration fees, title fees, and possibly sales taxes, depending on the vehicle's history and the specifics of the sale. It’s advisable to check with your local DMV for a complete breakdown of applicable fees.

input_text: Can a city just leave abandoned vehicles lying around?
target_text: No, cities are not allowed to leave abandoned vehicles lying around. Local ordinances require that these vehicles be removed and properly disposed of by licensed facilities, ensuring that they do not remain as an eyesore or safety hazard.

input_text: What types of applications should not be returned regarding a motor vehicle bond?
target_text: Applications that should not be returned include those involving a report of deposit of fees (RDF) for requesting a motor vehicle bond, a lien satisfied when there is a lien holder on record, or for an out-of-state title if the vehicle was originally titled in another state. These conditions must be separately addressed to ensure proper handling of the application.

input_text: What is included with the carbon monoxide stickers?
target_text: With the carbon monoxide stickers, vessel agents must also provide a companion brochure that gives additional information on the dangers of carbon monoxide and how to use the stickers effectively on the vessel.

input_text: How are trailers registered under the IRP?
target_text: Trailers do not fall under the IRP registration. Instead, they are registered separately as Permanent Trailer Identification (PTI). This means that if you have trailers, you need to follow the PTI registration process instead of using the IRP.

input_text: Is there any age requirement for a vehicle to obtain Horseless Carriage plates?
target_text: Yes, to qualify for Horseless Carriage License Plates, a vehicle must either have 16 or more cylinders and be manufactured before 1965 or be manufactured in 1922 or before.

input_text: What does it mean that a state is a title-issuing state for boats?
target_text: A title-issuing state for boats means that the state requires a title for vessels, which serves as legal proof of ownership. This process typically involves submitting specific documents to state agencies for approval before a boat can be registered. Certain states listed in the text either do not require titles or have specific regulations on which types of vessels need to be titled.

input_text: What is required from the buyer when purchasing a vehicle marked as junk?
target_text: The buyer must submit a completed Application for Title or Registration (REG 343) form, the REG 31 form for inspection of previously junked vehicles, and possibly a bill of sale to establish ownership. Additionally, they need to comply with any other requirements as per the Department of Motor Vehicles guidelines.

input_text: What forms and inspections are required for selling revived junk vehicles in California?
target_text: For revived junk vehicles, the seller must submit the certificate of title, registration card, and plate numbers, along with a completed Application for Title or Registration (REG 343) and a REG 31 form for inspection by an authorized DMV employee or the CHP. Other necessary forms may include smog certifications, brake and light adjustment certificates, and any needed bills of sale.

input_text: Can you explain the weight limits for an autoette?
target_text: Yes, an autoette must have an unladen weight of not greater than 1,800 pounds. This limit ensures that the vehicle fits within the regulations set for those types of vehicles, allowing for safe operation and registration.

input_text: Can I customize my Yosemite license plate?
target_text: Yes, you can customize your Yosemite license plate by applying for a personalized version, which allows you to have a specific combination of characters ranging from two to seven for most vehicles and two to five for motorcycles.

input_text: Is there a specific form I need to fill out for personalized Whale Tail License Plates?
target_text: Yes, you need to fill out the Special Interest License Plate Application (REG 17) form when applying for personalized Whale Tail License Plates.

input_text: Do I need to have multiple awards to get multiple LV license plates?
target_text: No, an LV award recipient is not required to hold more than one award in order to order multiple sets of LV license plates.

input_text: What form must be submitted for water tank trucks owned by equipment rental companies?
target_text: They must submit a REG 256 form along with the application for the SE plates.

input_text: What brake and light certificates are needed for registering my salvaged vehicle?
target_text: You need to provide either a Certificate of Compliance or a Certificate of Adjustment for both brake and light adjustments. The certificates must follow specific formats and dates. For example, certificates issued before November 30, 2015, may have different prefixes and formats compared to more current certificates. Make sure to have the appropriate documents ready to ensure compliance during the registration process.

input_text: Where do I need to put the helm sticker on my motorized vessel?
target_text: The helm sticker must be affixed to the interior of the motorized vessel in a location that is immediately visible to the operator. This ensures that the operator is consistently reminded of the dangers of carbon monoxide while operating the vessel.

input_text: Is there a different fee for processing a lien sale for a vessel and trailer?
target_text: Yes, when processing a lien sale for both a vessel and trailer, the cost cannot exceed $125.

input_text: What happens if I apply for a lien sale on a vessel?
target_text: If you apply for a lien sale on a vessel valued over $1500, the DMV will notify you of any outstanding property tax lien associated with the vessel. Additionally, the county that placed the lien will also be informed.

input_text: Can family members keep Purple Heart License Plates as heirlooms?
target_text: Yes, a limited number of family members, such as parents, children, siblings, and grandparents, may retain one Purple Heart License Plate as a family heirloom after the death of both the license plate owner and the surviving spouse. They must submit a Statement of Facts (REG 256) stating their relationship and confirming that the plate will not be placed on a vehicle.

input_text: Who is eligible for Disabled Person License Plates in California?
target_text: In California, Disabled Person License Plates (DP License Plates) can be issued to any passenger or commercial vehicles or motorcycles registered to a qualified permanently disabled person. Additionally, organizations or agencies that transport disabled persons solely for that purpose are also eligible for these plates.

input_text: What is a Dealer Statement of Facts (REG 477) form?
target_text: A Dealer Statement of Facts (REG 477) form is a document that must be completed when there is an issue related to how a vehicle was reported, particularly in cases where a dealer has reported a new vehicle incorrectly. This form requires the dealer to provide detailed descriptions of both the incorrectly reported vehicle and the vehicle that was actually sold. It is essential for correcting registration errors and ensuring that the proper vehicle is registered accurately.

input_text: Do vessel dealers have to be licensed in California?
target_text: No, vessel dealers are not required to be licensed by the DMV in California. However, they must comply with local and state business regulations, which may include obtaining permits from city and county administrations.

input_text: Do I need to provide a weight certificate when deleting a vehicle from IRP?
target_text: A weight certificate may be required when deleting a vehicle from IRP, depending on your vehicle's circumstances. Refer to Chapter 13 for exceptions to the weight certificate requirement.

input_text: Who prepares the MCO/MSO?
target_text: The MCO/MSO is typically prepared at the manufacturer's factory, assembly plant, or a business authorized by the manufacturer. It must meet specific formatting and content requirements to be valid.

input_text: How will I know if a salvage owner is displayed in the DMV's database?
target_text: The salvage owner will only show on the DMV's database if an automated salvage certificate has been issued. If the salvage certificate was issued manually, the salvage owner information will not be updated in the database.

input_text: Is there any situation where my previous years' fees could be credited?
target_text: Yes, your previous registration fees could be credited towards a future year only if you can provide substantiation that a refund for those fees is warranted. Without such justification, the fees remain due.

input_text: What do I get when I license my moped?
target_text: When you license your moped, you will receive a license plate and an identification card (ID) for your vehicle. However, a title will not be issued for mopeds.

input_text: What form do I need to submit to change my address with the DMV?
target_text: To change your address with the DMV, you need to submit a fully completed Change of Address form (DMV 14). You can send this form to the DMV address specified on the form or submit it online at dmv.ca.gov.

input_text: Can CVRA-registered vehicles have multiple types of stickers?
target_text: Yes, CVRA-registered vehicles are issued multiple types of stickers, including CVRA weight decals, CVRA year stickers, and regular ACTM year stickers, all of which serve different purposes.

input_text: Is there a distance limitation for operating a forklift truck on the highway?
target_text: Yes, there is a distance limitation. A forklift truck must not be operated along a highway for a distance greater than one-quarter mile to remain exempt from registration. If you exceed this distance, the forklift becomes subject to registration.

input_text: Do lienholders need to make the vessel available for inspection prior to the lien sale?
target_text: Yes, the lienholder must ensure that the vessel is available for public inspection for at least one hour prior to the scheduled sale. This is to provide transparency and allow interested parties the opportunity to view the vessel.

input_text: Do I need a smog certification for Foreign Organization License Plates?
target_text: A smog certification may be required for applying for Foreign Organization License Plates if it is applicable to your vehicle. This requirement is dependent on the vehicle's specifications and local emissions laws.

input_text: What happens if my name has changed?
target_text: If your name has changed, you need to follow specific procedures to update your vehicle's title in California. You will have to submit the California Certificate of Title or an Application for Replacement or Transfer of Title (REG 227) form, indicating your new name. If you do not have an out-of-state title, you may need the goldenrod registration along with completed REG 343 form. Additionally, you need to submit a name change document; it's important to note that certain changes, like a shift in business structure, are viewed as transfers, not simple name changes. A replacement title fee may apply, but there is no fee specifically for a name change.

input_text: How long does the DMV take to resolve an omitted lienholder issue?
target_text: The time it takes for the DMV to resolve an omitted lienholder issue can vary. Once you submit the application to the Involuntary Transfer Section (ITS), they will review it and take the necessary actions, which may include canceling the incorrect title and issuing a new one. However, there is no standardized timeframe mentioned, so it's best to follow up with the DMV for updates.

input_text: What do I need to submit to reassign my special license plates?
target_text: To reassign your special license plates, you need to submit: 1) the registration card in your name, 2) a Special Interest License Plate Application (REG 17) or a Special Recognition License Plate Application (REG 17A), 3) the special license plates assigned to the vehicle, and 4) any applicable fees.

input_text: Where do I apply to junk my vehicle?
target_text: You apply to the California Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) to record your vehicle as 'Junk.' This process requires filling out the necessary forms and providing specified documentation.

input_text: What is the timeline for the DMV to notify the lienholder after a Declaration of Opposition is filed?
target_text: The DMV has 16 days to notify the lienholder after receiving the completed Declaration of Opposition.

input_text: Are floating homes required to be registered in California?
target_text: Floating homes are generally not required to be registered in California if they are stationary, do not have their own power source, rely on shore utilities, and have a permanent sewage hookup to the shore. This exception allows them to operate as residential dwellings without the need for vessel registration.

input_text: Is it possible to transfer my Bicentennial Bill of Rights License Plate to another vehicle?
target_text: Yes, existing license plates can be reassigned as explained in the Reassignment of Special License Plates section.

input_text: Are there any exceptions for vehicles needing an SE plate?
target_text: Yes, implements of husbandry are optional for SE plates, meaning they do not necessarily need to display one.

input_text: What is the REG 156 and why is it important?
target_text: The REG 156 is a form that must be reviewed and completed during your application for substitute license plates. It requires you to include your name, driver's license or ID number, address, and signature. It is important because it is part of the documentation the DMV uses to process your request and verify your eligibility.

input_text: Are there any fees associated with getting new HAM license plates?
target_text: No fees are required for the replacement of HAM license plates as the replacement fee is waived for this type of license plate. However, you must still complete the relevant application forms and provide the necessary information for the issuance process.

input_text: What should I do if I receive SE ID cards with transfer information?
target_text: If you receive SE ID cards that contain transfer information, you should forward them to the Special Processing Unit (SPU) at DMV headquarters. This ensures that the transfer is properly documented and processed.

input_text: Does the bond need to be notarized?
target_text: Yes, the bond must be signed by the surety and the signature must be notarized. A bond that has a preprinted signature from the surety along with a notary acknowledgment is not acceptable.

input_text: What is the process for obtaining Gold Star Family License Plates?
target_text: To obtain Gold Star Family License Plates, the qualified family member must submit an Original Sequential License Plate Application that includes a Special Recognition License Plate Application (REG 17A) form, a Report of Casualty (DD 1300) form from the Department of Defense, a certified Project: Gold Star License Plate Application from a local County Veterans Service Official, and the required fees to the Special Processing Unit (SPU) at the DMV headquarters.

input_text: What happens after I report my vessel as stolen?
target_text: Once you report your vessel as stolen, the law enforcement agency will notify the Department of Justice (DOJ). The DOJ flags the vessel record in their system, which helps in tracking and recovering the vessel.

input_text: Which types of vehicles can get a 'title only' in California?
target_text: In California, a 'title only' can be issued for implements of husbandry, special construction equipment, and special mobile equipment that are exempt from registration or do not require a special ID plate. These vehicles are typically not used primarily on public roads.

input_text: Are there any conditions under which exempt agencies must still pay fees?
target_text: Yes, while exempt agencies are generally exempt from all vessel fees, they may still be required to pay replacement/substitute fees. This is a distinct type of fee that does not fall under the general exemption.

input_text: Who provides the YOM license plates?
target_text: The vehicle owner is responsible for supplying the YOM license plates. Once provided, the plates must be authenticated by DMV personnel to ensure they meet the necessary criteria.

input_text: Are pleasure CF numbers reserved for specific users?
target_text: No, pleasure CF numbers are not reserved as special numbers. They are issued by field offices and vessel agents and apply to both pleasure and commercial vessels, meaning they can be assigned to any eligible vessel without special reservation requirements.

input_text: Can I use copies of documents for registering a homemade vehicle made from purchased parts?
target_text: Yes, you can submit copies of documents such as invoices or receipts for materials purchased in bulk to construct a homemade vehicle, but this is at the discretion of the office manager. You must also provide a Statement of Facts (REG 256) form, indicating that the materials were specifically purchased for use in the vehicle or vessel.

input_text: What are the operational restrictions for farm vehicles on highways?
target_text: Farm vehicles cannot operate laden for more than two miles from the point of origin, unladen for more than 30 miles, or unladen for more than 15 miles unless they are accompanied by an escort vehicle. These restrictions ensure the safe use of farm vehicles on public roads.

input_text: Can I submit my application to correct a vessel certificate online?
target_text: The procedure for correcting a vessel certificate may vary by state and specific DMV regulations. It's best to check with your local DMV office to see if they accept online submissions or if you need to submit the documents in person or via mail.

input_text: Do I need to register my disaster relief vehicle?
target_text: No, disaster relief vehicles are exempt from regular registration; however, they require a special permit to operate in a disaster relief capacity during a state of emergency.

input_text: What should I do if my special equipment license plates are lost?
target_text: If your special equipment license plates are lost, you can obtain replacements by submitting an Application for Special Equipment Identification Plate (REG 88) form along with the required fees to the Special Processing Unit (SPU) at DMV headquarters.

input_text: Is there a fee for renewing CalAg License Plates?
target_text: Yes, there is an additional fee required for the renewal or reassignment of CalAg License Plates. This fee is separate from the initial application fees.

input_text: If my vehicle is marked as 'junk', how quickly can I dismantle it?
target_text: If your vehicle has a 'junk' status on DMV's record, you can dismantle it immediately without needing to wait.

input_text: What happens if I don't have my license but need to apply for replacement plates?
target_text: If you do not have a California driver's license or an out-of-state ID, you must present an acceptable secondary photo ID. If you cannot provide any required identification, they cannot accept your REG 156 application.

input_text: What conditions can lead to a vehicle being categorized as nonrepairable?
target_text: A vehicle can be categorized as nonrepairable if it meets specific criteria such as being completely stripped after recovery from theft, being completely burned, or being declared by the owner as irreversibly designated as a source for parts or scrap metal.

input_text: What specific details should be included in the letter to update my address?
target_text: In your letter to update your address, you should include the following details: a clear statement requesting a legal owner change of address, your name and new address as the legal owner, a list of the vehicles to be updated (including make, license plate number, and vehicle identification number or VIN), and the names of the registered owner(s) of those vehicles.

input_text: What happens after the first 500 SPCNS Certificates of Sequence are issued?
target_text: After the first 500 SPCNS Certificates of Sequence are issued each year, any additional SPCNS vehicles will be evaluated for emission requirements by the Bureau of Automotive Repair (BAR). Owners of such vehicles may need to contact a BAR referee for further information on their specific emission standards.

input_text: What happens if my vehicle title has an incorrect lienholder listed?
target_text: If your vehicle title has an incorrect lienholder listed, you can apply for a correction through the DMV. The DMV will cancel the incorrect title and issue a corrected title to the proper lienholder, assuming that the vehicle does not have another lien on it. They will also place a stop on the vehicle record, preventing any further issues until the situation is resolved.

input_text: Is the California State Parks Division of Boating and Waterways required to pay vessel fees?
target_text: No, the California State Parks Division of Boating and Waterways (DBW) is exempt from all vessel fees and replacement/substitute fees. This means they do not have to pay these specific fees when utilizing vessels.

input_text: Can I get a Breast Cancer Awareness License Plate for my motorcycle?
target_text: Yes, you can get Breast Cancer Awareness License Plates for motorcycles. The available configurations for motorcycle plates range from two to five characters.

input_text: Can I transfer my Historical Vehicle License Plates to another vehicle?
target_text: No, Horseless Carriage and Historical Vehicle License Plates are permanently assigned to the vehicle they are registered to and cannot be reassigned to another vehicle.

input_text: Under what circumstances would I need to get a motor vehicle bond?
target_text: You will need to get a motor vehicle bond when a vehicle has been sold as salvage and a regular title cannot be presented. This is typically the case when an insurance company has declared the vehicle as salvage due to damage or other issues, and it must be reported accordingly.

input_text: Can the proceeds from a lien sale be used for anything other than paying the lien?
target_text: No, the proceeds from a lien sale are specifically required to first cover the lien itself, which includes towing, storage, or repair fees, as well as any costs associated with conducting the lien sale.

input_text: What must a lienholder provide if a Declaration of Opposition is submitted?
target_text: If a Declaration of Opposition is received, the lienholder must provide additional documentation to the buyer. This includes a copy of a court judgment along with a Statement of Facts (REG 256), indicating that five days have passed since the judgment without payment received, a Declarant’s release with an original signature, and a letter of authorization from the DMV to continue with the lien sale.

input_text: Who can be an authorized officer for an acknowledgment?
target_text: Authorized officers who can perform acknowledgments typically include notaries public, but may also include other designated officials depending on the jurisdiction.

input_text: What does it mean to suspend a transaction for a government surplus vehicle?
target_text: Suspending a transaction for a government surplus vehicle means that the application for registration is held until specific conditions are met or additional information is provided. For example, transactions for military vehicles like Humvees must be sent to the Technical Compliance Section (TCS) at DMV headquarters for review before proceeding.

input_text: What if the 30 days have passed and I still haven't received my documents?
target_text: If 30 days have passed and you still have not received your documents, you can proceed to apply for a nonreceipt replacement. Ensure that you follow the specific procedures for your document type and fill out the application accurately.

input_text: Can I submit these forms online?
target_text: Whether you can submit the California Certificate of Title or REG 227 form online depends on the specific circumstances and the California DMV's policies. While some transactions can be processed online, others may require in-person visits. It is best to check the California DMV website or contact them directly to determine the submission options available for your particular case.

input_text: What are the notarization requirements for a REG 5057 bond?
target_text: The REG 5057 bond must be signed by the surety, and the signature must be notarized. A bond that has a preprinted signature without a proper notarization will not be accepted.

input_text: What is included in the REG 7 application process?
target_text: The REG 7 application process involves submitting a completed form that includes various copies distributed similarly to the Application for Registration of New Vehicle (REG 397). This includes proper documentation from the remanufacturer confirming the vehicle's status as remanufactured.

input_text: What tax records do I need to submit for my vessel registration?
target_text: When registering your vessel, you should provide copies of tax records that demonstrate payment to the County Assessor’s Office. This serves as evidence of ownership in the absence of formal ownership documents.

input_text: Can a disabled person use their vehicle for business if it has DP License Plates?
target_text: No, Disabled Person License Plates cannot be issued for vehicles used by a disabled person in a street vending business operation. They are specifically intended for transportation purposes that cater exclusively to the needs of disabled persons.

input_text: What must I do to surrender my personalized license plates to the DMV?
target_text: To surrender your personalized license plates to the DMV, you need to complete a Special Interest License Plate Application (REG 17) form that indicates you are surrendering the plates and releasing your priority. Additionally, you must physically return the license plates to the DMV.

input_text: Where do I need to send my application for replacement license plates or ID cards?
target_text: You must forward your application for replacement license plates or ID cards to the Special Processing Unit (SPU) at DMV headquarters.

input_text: What happens if I received two notices but I don't know which one to use?
target_text: In such cases, you need to determine which renewal notice is correct. After identifying the correct notice, you must close the incorrect vehicle record by keying the appropriate planned nonoperation (PNO) code or submitting additional documentation and fees as necessary.

input_text: Can I apply for replacements online?
target_text: The knowledge text does not specify whether online applications are accepted. Typically, applications must be forwarded to the Special Processing Unit (SPU) at DMV headquarters. You may want to check the DMV website or contact them for online options.

input_text: What does the Mussel Fee Paid sticker signify?
target_text: The Mussel Fee Paid sticker serves as evidence of payment of the Mussel Fee. It must be attached to the vessel and allows the vessel to be operated in all waters of the state unless there are specific prohibitions against it.

input_text: Do I need a vessel agent to register my vessel?
target_text: No, using a vessel agent is not required to register your vessel in California. You can complete the registration directly through DMV offices. However, if you prefer assistance, a vessel agent can help simplify the process.

input_text: What form do I need to fill out to replace my special equipment license plates?
target_text: To replace your special equipment license plates, you need to fill out the Application for Special Equipment Identification Plate (REG 88) form.

input_text: Why is a VIN required for low-value vehicles that do not have disposal authorization?
target_text: A VIN is crucial for identifying vehicles and establishing legal ownership. When a low-value vehicle is removed and does not have disposal authorization, assigning a VIN allows the vehicle to be formally documented and helps facilitate future processes, ensuring that any actions taken with the vehicle comply with transportation and vehicle ownership laws.

input_text: What is the significance of the 20-day calculation for fee payment?
target_text: The 20-day calculation is important because it determines the overall deadline for payment of fees related to the sale of the vehicle. Failing to pay these fees within the 20-day timeframe could lead to penalties or the inability to register the vehicle.

input_text: Is there a deadline for notifying the DMV about my new address as a legal owner?
target_text: Yes, as a legal owner (LO), you are required to notify the DMV of any change of address within 10 days. This prompt notification helps maintain accurate records and ensures that you receive important communications regarding your vehicle.

input_text: What are the requirements to obtain a Historical Vessel Plaque?
target_text: To obtain a Historical Vessel Plaque, you need to submit a completed Application for Historical Vessel Plaque (BOAT 100) form along with the required fee.

input_text: What if my vehicle is not registered in my name, but I want to use personalized plates?
target_text: If your vehicle is not registered in your name, you must have the registered owner complete a Statement of Facts (REG 256) form, stating that you are authorized to use the personalized license plates on that vehicle.

input_text: Do I need to provide my vehicle ownership certificate to change my address?
target_text: No, you do not need to provide the Certificate of Ownership or the certificate of number to change or correct your address. The process does not require these documents.

input_text: What happens if a removed vehicle is unclaimed?
target_text: If the vehicle remains unclaimed after 15 days from the notification date, the public agency must complete the Public Agency Authorization to Dispose of a Vehicle Valued at $500 or Less (REG 462). This applies if the towing and storage fees were not paid and no request for a post-storage hearing was made or attended.

input_text: Is it possible to skip the use tax when transferring title for auction sales?
target_text: Yes, when transferring a title for a vehicle being sold at an auction, the use tax is not required to be paid.

input_text: What are Horseless Carriage and Historical Vehicle License Plates?
target_text: Horseless Carriage and Historical Vehicle License Plates are special license plates designated for certain old or vintage vehicles that meet specific qualifications, allowing them to be reconstructed or put back into operation. These plates provide a legal way for historic vehicles to be used while preserving their status.

input_text: What should I do if I lost my salvage vehicle certificate?
target_text: If you lost your salvage vehicle certificate, you can apply for a duplicate. You'll need to submit a completed Application for Salvage Certificate or Nonrepairable Vehicle Certificate (REG 488C) form, along with a completed Statement of Facts (REG 256) form that describes the vehicle and certifies the disposition of the original certificate.

input_text: What if my vehicle record still shows me as the owner after I've sold it?
target_text: If your vehicle record still reflects your name as the owner, you will need to submit the incorrect registration card and a REG 256 form stating that the vehicle was registered erroneously for the current registration year and that you did not operate it. You must also include details about the intended vehicle and the buyer.

input_text: What information do I need to include in the REG 227 form?
target_text: When completing the REG 227 form, you must provide the registered owner's name, address, driver’s license or identification number, and a Missing Title Statement in the appropriate sections.
